hedline.hl1: Colleges to Collaborate On Commerce Links

abstract.p: Pace University forms partnership with SUNY New Paltz and Marist College to link computer science research to electronic commerce services (S)

block.p: Pace University has formed a partnership with SUNY New Paltz and Marist College in Poughkeepsie to link computer science research to electronic commerce services.

The Hudson Valley Center for Emerging Technologies will link the computer science and economics departments of the schools to local businesses that thrive on the Internet through research projects and a Web site displaying results and resources.
Pace University has formed a partnership with SUNY New Paltz and Marist College in Poughkeepsie to link computer science research to electronic commerce services.

The Hudson Valley Center for Emerging Technologies will link the computer science and economics departments of the schools to local businesses that thrive on the Internet through research projects and a Web site displaying results and resources.

Collaboration on topics like data mining and cataloging computer software will be a priority, said Susan Merritt, dean of computer science at Pace, which does research for businesses and offers training and consulting.
The state has given $250,000 to the consortium, which will be used to pay faculty members and researchers.
